Welcome to the the Columbia Biostatistics Computing Club!

The computing club hosts casual seminars focusing on computational topics often encountered in biostatistics research. The tutorials provide hands-on learning at a variety of skill levels, with some focused on bringing new students up to speed and others addressing more advanced problems. Our overarching goal is to impart good programming practices that encourage collaborative reproducible research!

The club meets monthly on Thursdays from 4:00-5:00pm in the biostatistics computer lab.

This year's organizers are Julia Wrobel and Ariel Chernofsky, both students in the Department of Biostatistics at Columbia University. The group is run with the help of faculty advisor Christine Mauro. A schedule for the upcoming semester is below. If there are other topics you'd like to cover in the future, please let us know!

Spring 2017 Schedule

  • January 19: Introduction to R and R Markdown with Ariel Chernofsky. Get files below:
    • rMarkdown Exercise
    • Ariel's rMarkdown Slides
    • Ariel's sample rMarkdown file
  • February 23: The beauty of ggplot2 with Jihui Lee
  • March 23: Interactive visualization using RStudio's Shiny with Julia Wrobel
  • April 20: Using GitHub for collaboration and version control with Jeff Goldsmith

Find R markdown files for past topics under resources tab.
